channel.title: Abu Dhabi on 0x000216
channel.description: Recent content in Abu Dhabi on 0x000216

item.title: The Al Ain Cultural Programme for 2017/2018 is currently in full swing
item.description: The Department of Culture and Tourism – Abu Dhabi recently held three events showcasing Emirati culture and heritage as part of the annual Al Ain Cultural Programme. On October 19th, Qasr Al Muwaiji (Al Muwaiji Palace) hosted the Bisht Workshop, which delved into the history of the traditional garment worn by UAE rulers and the unique patterns associated with each ruler. Attendees also participated in a hands-on workshop, learning to create their own bisht.

item.title: ADIB and Rotana have partnered to introduce the exclusive ADIB Rotana Rewards Card
item.description: Abu Dhabi Islamic Bank (ADIB) and Rotana, a hotel management company, have teamed up to introduce the ADIB Rotana Rewards Exclusive Card. This card allows members to earn Rotana Rewards points and enjoy special benefits whenever they use it for purchases. Source: ADIB. From left: Sarvesh Sarup, Global Head of Retail Banking, ADIB, and Omer Z. Kaddouri, President and CEO Rotana. This card is the first of its kind in the Central Eastern Europe & Middle East and Africa (CEEMEA) region to be co-branded with a hospitality company and developed by a local issuer.

item.title: Lunch meetings for business at the Jumeirah at Etihad Towers
item.description: As summer approaches, Jumeirah at Etihad Towers in Abu Dhabi is launching two new business lunch deals. Quest Quest, situated on the 63rd floor, is the highest restaurant in Abu Dhabi. It presents a three-course business lunch, crafted by an award-winning chef, from Sunday to Thursday, 12 pm to 3:30 pm. Priced at AED 145, it includes a complimentary glass of wine and coffee. Scott’s Scott’s, a renowned seafood restaurant, offers a specialized business lunch menu.

item.title: The inaugural commercial flight of the Etihad Boeing 787 Dreamliner is headed to Germany
item.description: Source: Etihad. Etihad Airways, the flag carrier of the UAE, launched its inaugural Boeing 787 Dreamliner commercial flight. The first flight, a Boeing 787-9, flew from Abu Dhabi to Düsseldorf, Germany. Departing at 2:15 a.m. as flight EY23, the seven-hour, 25-minute journey landed at 6:40 a.m. The return leg from Düsseldorf departs at 10:20 a.m., arriving in Abu Dhabi at 7:50 p.m. James Hogan, Etihad Airways’ President and CEO, stated that the Boeing 787 is a significant achievement for the airline, calling it the most technologically sophisticated aircraft in its class.

item.title: Abu Dhabi International Airport has increased its summer flights by 18% compared to 2013
item.description: Abu Dhabi International Airport’s summer 2014 flight schedule is its busiest ever, featuring six new destinations and 71 additional weekly flights to India. Airport authorities reported an 18% increase in weekly flights compared to the previous summer, rising from 1,052 to 1,242, catering to both business and leisure travelers. New nonstop routes debuting this summer include flights from Abu Dhabi to Los Angeles, Zurich, Belgrade (Serbia), Perth, Jaipur, and Yerevan (Armenia).

item.title: Etihad Airways now offers Boeing 787-9 Dreamliner on flights from Abu Dhabi to Shanghai
item.description: Etihad Airways has upgraded its Abu Dhabi to Shanghai route, now offering flights on the Boeing 787-9 Dreamliner. This change increases capacity by 14%, offering 28 business class and 271 economy seats. Etihad Airways’ CEO, Peter Baumgartner, highlighted the significance of the Chinese market, particularly the rising demand from business and leisure travelers. The decision to utilize the Dreamliner reflects Shanghai’s status as a major global hub and its importance in Etihad’s network.

item.title: Etihad Airways introduces more flights on the Abu Dhabi to Doha route
item.description: Etihad Airways is commemorating a decade of service to Qatar this year by adding nine weekly flights to its Abu Dhabi-Doha route, strengthening its dedication to this important Gulf market. Starting August 1, 2016, the UAE’s national airline will boost its weekly service to Qatar’s capital to 37 flights. These new daily morning and early evening departures on Thursdays and Saturdays offer more flexibility and convenience, catering to business travelers in both Abu Dhabi and Doha.

item.title: The Abu Dhabi National Exhibition Centre now offers complimentary Wi-Fi
item.description: Guests at the Abu Dhabi National Exhibition Centre (ADNEC) can enjoy free Wi-Fi access through the ‘ADNEC Free Wi-Fi’ network. Humaid Matar Al Dhaheri, Acting Group CEO of Abu Dhabi National Exhibitions Company, stated that providing complimentary Wi-Fi highlights ADNEC’s focus on using technology to improve visitor experiences. This service eliminates the need for visitors to seek out basic internet access, aligning with ADNEC’s commitment to developing its technological infrastructure and enhancing service offerings to meet the changing needs of its stakeholders.

item.title: Etihad Airways is the designated airline sponsor for WorldSkills Abu Dhabi 2017
item.description: The image showcases young people at work, sourced from the WorldSkills Abu Dhabi 2017 website. Etihad Airways is the official airline sponsor for WorldSkills Abu Dhabi 2017, a major international event focusing on vocational education and skills excellence. Taking place at the Abu Dhabi National Exhibition Centre (ADNEC) from October 14th to 17th, 2017, the event will host over 3,000 participants and experts representing approximately 75 countries. WorldSkills encompasses a variety of industries, from construction and creative fields like arts and fashion to technology, manufacturing, engineering, social services, and transport.

item.title: Etihad introduces A380 flights connecting Abu Dhabi and Mumbai
item.description: Etihad Airways, the national airline of the UAE, will begin operating its Airbus A380 aircraft between Abu Dhabi and Mumbai starting May 1, 2016. This comes after the successful introduction of the A380 on routes to Sydney and, beginning in June 2016, Melbourne. The airline’s 496-seat A380, based in Abu Dhabi, offers 50% more seating capacity than the Boeing B777-300ER it is replacing. This allows Etihad to provide more travel options and boost tourism between India, the US, and Abu Dhabi.

item.title: In 2017, Etihad will assume control of Virgin's Sydney-Abu Dhabi slots
item.description: Etihad Airways will increase flights between Abu Dhabi and Sydney to twice daily starting February 6, 2017. Flights EY450 departing Abu Dhabi in the morning and EY451 departing Sydney in the afternoon will now operate seven days a week. This schedule change coincides with strategic partner Virgin Australia’s move to shift its Abu Dhabi operations from Sydney to Perth, effective June 9, 2017. Etihad Airways will expand its current codeshare agreement with Virgin Australia to include their new tri-weekly Perth-Abu Dhabi flights.

item.title: Complimentary stopovers offered to Etihad Economy Class passengers traveling from the Middle East, Africa, and Pakistan
item.description: Etihad Airways, the national airline of the UAE, is offering a complimentary one-night stay at the Radisson Blu hotel on Abu Dhabi’s Yas Island. This offer is open to Economy Class passengers flying from the Middle East, Africa, and Pakistan who have a layover in Abu Dhabi. Mohammad Al Bulooki, Etihad Airways Executive VP Commercial, expressed the airline’s enthusiasm for showcasing Abu Dhabi to its guests. He highlighted the diverse attractions of the UAE capital, ranging from cultural landmarks and beaches to sports and adventure activities.

item.title: The First and Business Class Lounge at Abu Dhabi Airport Terminal 1 has been reopened by Etihad
item.description: Etihad Airways has officially reopened its First and Business Class Lounge at Abu Dhabi Airport’s Terminal 1 after a complete renovation. The improved lounge, open around the clock, spans over 1,044 square meters and can accommodate 134 guests. This updated space in Terminal 1 provides a variety of amenities to meet the needs of modern business and leisure travelers. Mirroring the lounge in Terminal 3, the refurbished facility features comfortable seating, a designated dining area, modern business facilities, complimentary Wi-Fi, USB charging ports, restrooms with shower facilities, and a children’s play area.

item.title: Special discounts are available for group bookings for iftar and suhoor at the Armed Forces Officers Club & Hotel in Abu Dhabi
item.description: Source: Armed Forces Officers Club & Hotel website. The Armed Forces Officers Club & Hotel (AFOCH) in Abu Dhabi is offering special group rates for iftar and suhoor. The iftar buffet, which includes Ramadan juices, is priced at AED 180*, with a discounted rate of AED 170 per person for groups of 10 or more. Using the coupon system**, the price drops to AED 150 per person. The suhoor buffet, also with Ramadan juices, costs AED 90 per person.

item.title: Etihad, TCA Abu Dhabi, and Miral collaborate to showcase Abu Dhabi as a preferred destination
item.description: Etihad Airways has partnered with the Abu Dhabi Tourism & Culture Authority (TCA Abu Dhabi) and Miral Asset Management (Miral) to enhance Abu Dhabi’s standing as a top global destination for tourism, business, and culture. This collaboration will see the three entities working together to attract more visitors and stopover travelers to Abu Dhabi. Joint efforts will include marketing and communication initiatives, sharing market insights and data, developing loyalty programs, and organizing business and leisure events both within the Emirate and internationally.

item.title: TripAdvisor has announced the winners of the Travelers' Choice awards for world landmarks
item.description: TripAdvisor, the popular travel website, has revealed the winners of its Travelers’ Choice awards for top global attractions. Now in their second year, the awards recognized 929 attractions, with a special highlight on the top 25. Asian and Middle Eastern landmarks secured four spots in the global top ten, while an Australian park earned a coveted place among the top ten parks worldwide. Top 10 World Landmarks Sheikh Zayed Grand Mosque, Abu Dhabi, United Arab Emirates

item.title: Etihad announces first destinations for Airbus A380 and Boeing 787 Dreamliner aircraft
item.description: Etihad Airways, the national airline of the United Arab Emirates, has announced the initial destinations for its new Airbus A380 and Boeing 787 Dreamliner aircraft. Source: Etihad. The Boeing 787-9. The Abu Dhabi-based airline will start flying its first A380 to London’s Heathrow Airport in December 2014, with a second A380 added to the same route in the first quarter of 2015. By the end of 2015, Etihad Airways will have five A380s in service, with plans to also introduce them on routes to Sydney and New York’s JFK Airport.

item.title: Fikra Labs aims to speed up innovation in the travel and tourism industry
item.description: In February, during UAE Innovation Month, which promotes the country’s global innovation hub status and recognizes innovators, four Abu Dhabi groups are collaborating with Wamda, an entrepreneurship platform, to launch the Fikra Labs acceleration program. The partners, including the Department of Culture and Tourism – Abu Dhabi, Miral Asset Management, Etihad Aviation Group, and Abu Dhabi National Exhibitions Company (ADNEC), with support from Abu Dhabi Global Market (ADGM), aim to boost innovation and entrepreneurship in Abu Dhabi’s travel and tourism industry.

item.title: AFOCH invites businesses to gather for iftar during Ramadan
item.description: Source: AFOCH website. The Armed Forces Officers Club & Hotel (AFOCH) in Abu Dhabi is hosting Iftar celebrations ideal for gatherings with business associates. Peter Freeman, the Deputy Director General of the Armed Forces Officers Club & Hotel, highlighted that the hotel’s leading chefs will once again prepare a grand Iftar buffet. The buffet will feature exquisite Arabic delicacies alongside international dishes. “Here at the Armed Forces Officers Club & Hotel, we provide the most authentic Arabic cuisine, meticulously crafted with the freshest ingredients by our highly skilled culinary team,” Freeman stated.

item.title: Etihad plans to increase the number of flights between Abu Dhabi and Melbourne
item.description: Etihad Airways, the national airline of the United Arab Emirates, will begin offering daily A380 flights between Abu Dhabi and Melbourne starting June 1, 2016. This will affect flight numbers EY460/461, one of the airline’s two daily trips between the cities. This change replaces one of the three-class Boeing 777-300ER aircraft currently used. Passengers can now enjoy The Residence by Etihad, a luxurious private three-room suite, and other cutting-edge products and services across all cabins.

item.title: Etihad is increasing the number of weekly flights between Abu Dhabi and Manila
item.description: Starting May 1, 2016, Etihad Airways will increase its Abu Dhabi to Manila route from 14 to 17 roundtrip flights per week. This provides convenient connections from Abu Dhabi’s hub to popular destinations for Philippine travelers, including Bahrain, Kuwait, Dammam, Doha, Jeddah, and Riyadh. Etihad Airways’ President and CEO, James Hogan, highlighted the Abu Dhabi-Manila route’s high demand and limited capacity in recent years. The added flights will increase capacity by nearly 2,500 seats weekly, improving travel options between the UAE and the Philippines.
